sentences.en: A battle over music royalties threatens a nascent industry.
sentences.cn: 音乐版税之战攸关新兴行业存亡.

sentences.en: A nascent environmental protection industry has also emerged.
sentences.cn: 另外,中国的环境保护产业也逐渐出现.

sentences.en: But higher fuel costs could hurt China's manufacturers, hindering the economy's nascent recovery.
sentences.cn: 但成品油价格上涨可能会冲击到中国的制造业, 阻碍中国经济初露萌芽的复苏.

sentences.en: China is one: Even if its nascent economic recovery falters, it will likely keep gobbling commodities.
sentences.cn: 中国就是其中 之一: 即使中国的经济复苏昙花一现, 但它也很可能继续大肆购买大宗商品.

sentences.en: Nascent nano technologies are mashed up with bio technologies.
sentences.cn: 新生的纳米技术与生物科技糅合起来.

sentences.en: Or degree, or will a certificate or nascent license be in love. enough?
sentences.cn: 或者学校的证书或者执照够不够?

sentences.en: That slim book showed the Chinese intelligentsia and the nascent working class.
sentences.cn: 那本小册子讲述了中国的知识界和新兴的工人阶级.

sentences.en: The fund management industry on the mainland is still at a nascent stage.
sentences.cn: 中国内地的基金管理业仍处于萌芽阶段.

sentences.en: They argue that a strengthening of the currency would derail their nascent recovery.
sentences.cn: 他们声称,货币升值会阻碍刚刚开始的制造业恢复进程.

sentences.en: This is the prime ratio of the nascent increments.
sentences.cn: 这是最初增量的最初比.

words.tran_cn: [生物]初期的；开始存在的，发生中的

trans.tran_cn: 初期的， 初生的，开始形成的，发生中的
trans.tran_en: coming into existence or starting to develop
